wikipedia_page.main: Henry Bret Ince QC (1830 – 7 May 1889) was a British businessman, writer, and politician.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1885 United Kingdom general election

response: * Henry Bret Ince (1830–1889), British businessman, writer and politician

The by-election was caused by the death of the sitting Liberal MP, Sir George Radford at the age of 66.The Times, 8 October 1917 p1 Radford had won the seat at the 1906 general election and held it since then but Islington East was not a safe Liberal seat. It was created in 1885 and won for the Liberals in that year's general election by Henry Bret Ince. But Ince lost to the Conservatives in 1886 and the Tories held it until Radford's victory in 1906.F W S Craig, British Parliamentary Election Results 1885-1918; Macmillan Press, 1974, 23 However, during the First World War there was an electoral truce between the main political parties by which it was agreed that all by-election vacancies would be filled unopposed. The Liberal Party could therefore expect their chosen candidate to face no Conservative or Labour opponent.
